column1: Any program which browses store pages (be it search engine bot or customer's browser) sends information about itself (so called user agent string). Field above is used to match any of semicolon separated values inside user agent string and to decide whether bot or real user is currently browsing.
column2: Any program which browses store pages (be it search engine bot or customer's browser) sends information about itself (so called user agent string). Field above is used to match any of semicolon separated values inside user agent string and to decide whether bot or real user is currently browsing.

column1: Yes for Users, No for Search Bots (Listed Below)
column2: Yes for Users, No for Search Bots (Listed Below)

column1: Recommended setting is 'Yes for Users, No for Search Bots' because search bots crawl non-AJAX pages better while users prefer AJAX page refreshes
column2: Recommended setting is 'Yes for Users, No for Search Bots' because search bots crawl non-AJAX pages better while users prefer AJAX page refreshes
